security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and AI instruction templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or environment variable access. The skill describes desired AI behavior for merging HTML content.

content.user_title: Consolidate Chapter Pages into Single Document
content.value_statement: Split chapter pages create fragmented reading experiences and inconsistent formatting. This skill uses AI to intelligently merge individual HTML page files into seamless continuous chapters. It removes duplicate headers, normalizes heading hierarchy, and preserves all semantic structure for a unified document.
actual_capabilities: Merge multiple HTML page files into a single continuous chapter document
Remove duplicate headers, footers, and navigation from continuation pages
Normalize heading hierarchy across merged pages (h1 through h4)
Preserve semantic HTML classes and document structure
Generate consolidation metadata log with content statistics
limitations: Requires pre-extracted page HTML files from previous processing steps
Does not perform file I/O operations directly (operates via AI prompts)
AI makes judgment calls on heading hierarchy in ambiguous cases
Output quality depends on input page HTML completeness

use_cases.title: Convert paginated PDFs to continuous HTML
use_cases.description: Transform multi-page PDF-derived HTML into single-file chapters for consistent reading.

use_cases.title: Normalize chapter document structure
use_cases.description: Create uniform heading hierarchy and remove duplicate elements from merged content.

use_cases.title: Prepare unified chapter files
use_cases.description: Generate consolidated chapter documents ready for semantic validation and final output.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge these HTML pages into one continuous chapter document. Remove duplicate headers. Keep all content.

prompt_templates.title: Structured Merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge pages maintaining all semantic classes. Create single page-container. Normalize heading levels starting with h1 for chapter title.

prompt_templates.title: Full Specification
prompt_templates.prompt: Consolidate pages into single HTML5 document. Requirements: single page-container and page-content, remove page-break elements, preserve chapter header from page 1 only, normalize headings h1-h4, keep all text and exhibits exactly as written.

prompt_templates.title: Quality-Forward
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge all pages into continuous chapter. Return consolidated HTML and a JSON log with page count, heading counts, total paragraphs, word count, and consolidation timestamp. Ensure no duplicate content or hierarchy jumps.

output_examples.input: I have 14 HTML pages for Chapter 2 that need to be merged into one continuous document.
output: Chapter header preserved from opening page
Heading hierarchy normalized (1 h1, 4 h2, 12 h4)
Consolidation log saved with full metadata

best_practices: Verify all page HTML files exist and are valid before consolidation
Extract page 1 content with chapter header, subsequent pages without headers
Validate output has single page-container and page-content wrapper
Review heading hierarchy for unexpected level jumps
anti_patterns: Running consolidation before page extraction is complete
Skipping validation of merged document structure
Allowing duplicate headers or navigation in output
Merging pages with inconsistent semantic class naming

faq.question: What file formats are supported for input?
faq.answer: Input must be valid HTML files extracted from previous processing steps, containing page-content elements.

faq.question: How many pages can be merged at once?
faq.answer: The skill supports merging any number of pages. Large chapters may hit context limits depending on AI model used.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: This skill follows page extraction and precedes semantic validation. It reads page artifacts and outputs chapter artifacts.

faq.question: Is my data safe during processing?
faq.answer: This skill contains no executable code. All processing happens within the AI model context. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if output headings are misleveled?
faq.answer: The semantic validation gate will catch hierarchy issues. AI makes best effort, but refinement happens in later validation steps.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual concatenation?
faq.answer: Unlike simple concatenation, AI intelligently removes duplicates, normalizes structure, and ensures semantic consistency across all merged content.
